intro: Plagiobothrys tener, commonly known as the softleaf sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Plagiobothrys tener is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along streambanks.
